column2: What type of skin do you have?
column17: Skin-type I: very fair skin, blond or red hair, light eyes (blue or green), never tan and always sunburn after sun exposure
column18: Skin-type II: fair skin, blond or light-brown hair, light eyes (blue or green), usual sunburn
column19: Skin-type III: deep skin, brown hair, light to medium eye colour
column20: Skin-type IV: olive skin, dark-brown hair, brown eyes
column21: Skin-type V: brown skin, black hair, black eyes
column22: Skin-type VI: black skin, black hair, black eyes

column2: How many moles do you approximately have on the whole body?
Did you have one or more severe blistering sunburn as a child or teenage?
Did you live for more than one year in a country where sunshine is high (Africa, French West Indies, South of United States, Australia...)
Have you been diagnosed with melanoma in the past (it's a skin cancer, arising in melanocytes, skin cells that make skin pigment)?
Has any of your first degree relatives (parents, children, brother or sister) ever had melanoma?
